question: At the beginning of the party, there were 29 lawyers and 63 nurses. After 45 minutes, 1/4 of the total number of people left. How many nurses are left if 16 lawyers stayed at the party?
answer:
There were a total of 29 lawyers + 63 nurses = <<29+63=92>>92 people who attended the party.
After 45 minutes, 92 people * 1/4 = <<92*1/4=23>>23 people left the party.
This means 92 people - 23 people = <<92-23=69>>69 people stayed.
Out of the 69 who stayed, 69 people - 16 lawyers = <<69-16=53>>53 were nurses.
#### 53
